intro: Baeckea leptospermoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, often hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its small white or pinkish flowers are borne in clusters and are followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
